content: I skimmed around and couldn't find an obvious answer for this question, so posting here: Is there anywhere that publicly shows the specs for the rust-lang build servers? Obviously a fair number are in The Cloud tee emm and so the specs are more an abstract promise than a true reality, but I am curious to know what can be known.
The linux jobs print disk space and CPU info in some steps

GitHub has vague information at https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-github-hosted-runners/about-github-hosted-runners. That is mostly relevant for macOS, as we use special runners for linux and windows.

I think ubuntu-xl is 16 CPU with 64GB RAM with a giant 667G partition.
And I think windows-xl is 8 CPU with 32GB RAM 344G partition.
Oh, and there is also a self-host arm runner. It looks to be a relatively modest 14 CPU 16GB RAM system. I'm not sure if the exact specs were ever published anywhere.

Within recent history, the GitHub runners have used these CPUs:

Intel(R) Xeon(R) Platinum 8272CL CPU @ 2.60GHz
Intel(R) Xeon(R) Platinum 8171M CPU @ 2.60GHz
Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2673 v3 @ 2.40GHz
Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2673 v4 @ 2.30GHz
Intel(R) Xeon(R) Platinum 8370C CPU @ 2.80GHz
